name: Sheraton Waikiki

reviews.text: I don't know what else to say. It is a dump. Old, worn, badly in need of a total renovation. My room did not have the updated sweet sleeper beds yet. Actually I think the matress may have been the original from the 70's! The service from check-in to check out (and everything in between) is slow. The lobby area is quite busy and crowded. Parking is difficult to get into / out of (typical for Waikiki - not the hotel's fault). The spot on the beach is quite nice and the restaurants in the area are plentiful and good. I might consider spending points to stay here for the location, but not my own cash.
reviews.title: It is a dump

likes.liked: — I only had to stay 1 night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a tired old hotel that should have been torn down years ago. The elevators can not begin to keep up with the number of people trying to use them. The bus depot where you arrive from the airport has only stairs and no elevator which is just what you want after a long flight with a lot of heavy bags. No bellmen either. It is just disorganized chaos and the rooms are small, noisy, poorly equipped. The internet did work which is the only nice thing I can say about the place. They couldn't even make keys when we first checked in. Also, the place is completely over run with Japanese visitors.
reviews.title: Don't do it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Too much money for this 70's style decor hotel room. This hotel needs to upgrade their rooms. The Sheraton Waikiki has nicer rooms but this section of the hotel is not very nice looking.
reviews.title: Manor Wing

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki July 11-July 14. The room was just as the pictures had shown. Very clean and modern. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was great. If I had to complain about something, it would be the chairs on the balcony. They are very attractive, but not comfortable. We had an oceanfront room, which had a beautiful view of the pool area, the ocean, and Diamond Head. The nightly entertainment was very nice and relaxing. It was also very nice while eating dinner. If you enjoy swimming, it is a bother that the main pool closes when the entertainment begins. However, the ocean is great for swimming, and very fun if traveling with children. Side Note: the beach area to the left of the hotel (in front of the Royal Hawaiian) is the best area for relaxing and swimming. The room rate was VERY reasonable, trust me because I spent months researching hotels and their rates!! We also were very pleasantly greeted with lias upon our arrival to the hotel, which was a plus because we did not receive them at the airport! The lobby with all of it's shops is very beautiful and if I may mention, the hotel gift shop has great souvenirs with surprisingly reasonable prices! Overall the hotel is great! We loved our stay and definitely would return.
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again

reviews.text: I was a guest with my family at the Sheraton Waikiki while attending the National Medical Association convention. I booked a partial ocean view room and asked to be near my parents. The hotel accomadated that request very well by providing adjoining rooms. That is the last positive thing I have to say.
reviews.title: Roach Hotel
Wonderful hotel but the public beaches ?
reviews.text: We are now staying at the Sheraton Waikiki. The staff is wonderful, helpful , quick with any need , and the remodel is fantastic. Id recommend this hotel to any 5 star traveler. Due to the beautifully remodeled rooms, with flat screen tvs, and very W type streamline decor. Very comfortable beds, a serta or sealy perfect sleeper. Breathtaking views , and nice aloha flow. However the beach services are in need of help. The Mai Tai cruise is a beatiful catamaran ocean trip, however the staff who sign you up made us feel as though we were in a 3rd world country, it felt like they were hustling as though they needed the money, and you HAD to buy photos from the photographer who was not the friendliest . The surfing with Hans Hedelamann was really fun. I had Evan who made sure we all were up and really surfing , but my friends went out with another guy Sergient and he seemed preoccupied, and a bit rude. Sushi at the Sheraton was great , but the the sushi at Yunagi is a must ! Also we drove to the north shore ,and that is definetly worth the whole trip. Over all the Sheraton I say thumbs up but the beach needs to be redone! The people who work the pool and beach could be a bit more relaxed and friendlier! We sometimes felt we were staying at their "house" instead of a warm and friendly aloha! So dont go here if you want white sandy beaches, its a bit more rough, touristy, and the people who live here seem a bit rude, like your lucky to be there! Most were from CA which we found interesting. The Hawaiins seem very proud of their island, but the bar tenders and and again beach crew need more aloha spirit! Sadly the beach is a bit dirty, cig butts, in front of Halekulani , Sheraton and Royal Hawaiin. That was a bummer, and there was lots of plastic cups, etc in the water. So if they could clean up the beach and the people who hustle all these surf lesson, boat rides, etc and it would truly be paradise. I can imagine 30 yrs ago....wow.

reviews.title: Our 25th Anniversary Celebration in April 2006
reviews.text: I wanted to write to let you know that my wife and I spent 6 days at the Sheraton Wakikii and I must say our stay was amazing, although the Hotel Room we had was a basic room, we were upgraded to overlook the ocean and Diamond Head. We were able to see the giant sea turtles every night around 5:00 p.m as they were coming in to feed and from the 29th floor they looked huge so you can imagine how big they are up close.

reviews.title: Our cute little room: Sheraton's Budget "Manor Rooms"
reviews.text: During our visit there was a lot of construction going on around us but we did not hear any noise.
The only downfall with the Sheraton is that the beach is not directly in front of the hotel but off to the sides as they have a break wall outside the hotel and I found the beach to be too crowded.
reviews.title: Not bad, but very busy
Completely unethical
reviews.text: We also got to see the Front of Dog the Bounty Hunters Office in Honolulu and that was great.

I spent four nights at the hotel for a conference and was not impressed. The "conference rate" seemed to be quite high and was more likely a function of supply/demand than a reflection of value. The staff was pleasant and the meals prepared for the group ranged from acceptble to wonderful. However, the room was dowdy and there were some odd quirks. My message light stayed on all the time--despite no messages and repeated promises to fix it. The shower only pointed straight out, rather than down, which was very odd. My main complaint was the nickel and diming that was everywhere. They offered one free pack of in-room coffee with others available at a modest price. The bottled water could be taken for $4.25!! and there was no mileage credit given because of our "group" rate. I would neither go back nor recommend it based on my experience.
reviews.title: Try Anothr

reviews.text: Stayed here 5 years ago and it was great. The cleanest hotel I was ever in. Must be under different management now. Not as clean and getting worn looking. They are refurbishing rooms but those are looking ultra modern. They lost the Hawaiian Charm. This hotel has the best view in Waikiki. Oceanview with view of Diamondhead. Loved waking to that everyday for a week. We booked 7 months prior to vacation and asked for a king room. When we got there at 9:00 P.M. all they had was a shabby room with 2 full size beds. They told us to keep things packed and check with the desk the next morning for a king room. We did that. We got a king room but had to wait until after 3:00 that day to get into it. I think they should have had a king room reserved for us from the beginning.
reviews.title: Stayed 2/25/06-3/4/06
Manor Wing - only good for overnight
reviews.text: I have to give the Sheraton credit, we were staying in the "budget" Manor wing and because we were on our honeymoon (on our way to Kauai) they had champagne waiting for us in our room.
The room itself was basic but comfortable, very date, tatty carpets but clean and for the price quite good.
reviews.title: Outdated on the rooms, but can't beat the price for the location.....
out dated
reviews.text: We wouldn't stay in the Manor Wing again except for an overnight stay as we did last time, but would like to try the more upmarket accommodation. Everything went very smoothly and the buffet (which we paid for), was fantastic!

We just returned from Oahu where we had group reservations at the Sheraton Waikiki. I had read a wide range of reviews of this hotel in trip advisor and had some tripidations regarding dirty, old rooms with no view. Well, were we surprised upon arrival. We received a renovated oceanfront room with a view from the 20th floor. It was fabulous waking up each morning with the sun rising over Diamond Head and looking out into the Blue Hawaiian waters where the ocean meets the sky. The room on the lanai is generous enough to eat breakfast there each morning. You can stock up the refrigerator in the room by visiting one of the ubiquitous ABC stores for your supply of fruit, yogurt, drinks ... including beer, wine, and liquor. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. One early morning we had an emergency when one of us who is allergic to bees was stung. I called the front desk who immediately put us in contact with their "sister" hotel the Sheraton Princess where there is a "Doctor on Call". They came and picked us up, took us to the hotel to see the doctor, then drove us to a pharmacy to get a prescription filled, and returned us back to the Sheraton Waikiki. All was completed in a little over an hour. Don't be afraid to ask for anything. You can even get a late checkout the day of your departure if you have a late flight. We were able to extend until 9 PM for $100. We had a midnight flight so having our room until 9 PM allowed us to head to the beach and enjoy one last day of Waikiki knowing we had our room to shower and rest. One last note, be sure to do the snorkeling excursion on the Maita'i catamaran. We got to swim with a sea turtle while snorkeling ... it was awesome! The catamaran is docked and launches right on the beach in front of the hotel. We will be back!
reviews.title: Wonderful Accomodations

likes.liked: — oceanfront room with lanai and refrigerator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my new hubby stayed here 11-5-2006. We stayed on the 18th floor, partial ocean view room, it was awesome!! it was 260.00 a night, but it was worth it. The buffet at hotel is 20.00pp. So you may want to ck out other places to eat at. The shops are very expensive in the hotel. If you want souvieniers go to market place, or ABC stores, they are everywhere!!!
reviews.title: Awesome!!!!

reviews.text: they are walking distance from hotel. we went snorkeling in Hanauma Bay. pretty water!! did pear harbour, and layed out on the beach. they also have Cirque Hawaii, the show is awesome!

likes.liked: — The Sand Bar and Pool area and the lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also went to Turtle Bay North Shore, and did the Polynesian Culture, that was very interesting....If you have any questions about Oahu, shoot me an email, and i will try and answer ya!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: We will definately go back!
reviews.title: excelent except!!!!

reviews.text: After reading numerous Tripadvisor reviews, I was prepared for the worst, instead it was a fabulous trip. My hubbie and I were there for a convention so the accomodations were out of MY hands. We also celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary while there. Our room was on the 14th floor and overlooked the pool area, beach, ocean, and Diamond Head. It was awesome. As soon as we arrived, after travel from Florida, it was mid afternoon and we stepped onto the balcony...I was estatic. The view was enchanting but the honos (sea turtles) were mesmerizing. I couldn't stop watching them from the balcony and had to get out my zoom lenses. And we also watched whales from the balcony!!! The room was clean and furnishings nice. The hotel delivered us a bottle of champagne to our surprise. The staff was great! They gave us terrific recommendations for eats, drinks, souvrnirs, and sightseeing on our own around the island. And I could get a fresh lei everyday...what more could you ask for???
reviews.title: Surprisingly wonderful stay!

likes.liked: — clean room, comfortable bed and pillows, view of the honos, watching the evening dancers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 days beginning April 24, 2007 as a pre-cruise Ohau land vacation. We are Sheraton Vacation owners and used our Starwood points for this stay.
reviews.title: Nice stay but make sure you book a renovated room.

likes.disliked: — Too many people, very large hotel. No intimacy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had originally booked a Deluxe Ocean View Suite with a view of Diamond Head. This is a very pricey corner room using many thousands of points.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: When we arrived the room was on the 29th floor with an awesome view and was very large with a seperate dressing area and double sink bathroom. The room itself was very old and worn. Furniture looked like it was from the 50s. The two double beds (we were promised one king when reservations were made) were extremely hard and very uncomfortable. Not worth anywhere near what we were paying in points.
reviews.title: Location, renovated room

likes.disliked: — That nicer resorts like this nickel and dime you for every little thing (food, internet) when you have already paid a higher rate for the nicer resort.

reviews.text: We alerted the customer service that we were not happy with the room and the gentleman did all he could to satisfy us. We were told that none of the suites have been renovated as of yet. They are the last ones to be completed. There were no suites or other rooms in that class that were any different.
reviews.title: Did the job

likes.disliked: — Price of parking, cigarette smoke, large crowds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This I am sure will be my last trip to the HI Islands. Yes, Waikiki is huge, overbuilt and the Sheraton is old with very little beach. The staff appears to have come with the hotel (Vintage) and was very unfriendly from the bar to the restaurants. Charges for every thing and maybe they could purchase some new beach towels that are a little larger than a hand towel. Very disappointed, NEVER AGAIN!
reviews.title: Old, small rooms no beach Unfreindly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki in October 2006. We were on the 16th floor in one of the newly renovated rooms with an oceanfront view. After reading other reviews here, I called ahead and requested a renovated room and then confirmed when I checked in. We received a lei greeting upon checking in- what an unexpected surprise.
reviews.title: Renovated Rooms are Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was wonderful. Loved the lanai (balacony). The room was as beauitful in person as is photographed on their website. Despite what I read here I did not find the elevator wait to be be too long. Housekeeping was excelent.
reviews.title: Good location run down rooms

reviews.text: Unforunatley, I found the "aloha sprit" to be waning with all non-tipped staff in Waikiki, including the staff at the Sheraton. We spent three days on Maui where the locals find it much easier to smile and "talk story" than on Oahu. Next year we are flying directly to Maui and skipping the Wakiki exerience.
reviews.title: Nice room, convenient location, friendly service

likes.disliked: — Long lines at the front desk

reviews.title: Decent hotel, but avoid the manor/annex!
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was central to all the shops and main tourist area but the room had stained musty carpet and you could actually see a holes in the walls on both sides of the wall air conditioner. I'm sure there are a bunch of better hotels for the same or a better value. You can definitely do better
Stayed there for a convention.Hotel is old and for the most part unrenovated our room which was a suite had filthy carpet peeling paint and mold painted over.
reviews.title: Hotel is from the Brady Bunch era

reviews.text: They have no beach except at low tide and then its about 8 ft

reviews.text: but their is a beach at other hotels so you just walk there.Pools are very small but clean
reviews.title: pleasant despite no-view accessible room

reviews.text: The hotel staff does try very hard and the resturant on the 31 st fl.is very good.
reviews.title: Nice Ocean Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would probably be more negative but this was a free trip had I had to pay for it I would have been screaming.Not the true HI exp.like Manhattan with a beach
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a well run, fast-paced hotel. There was a huge convention and lots of guests while we were there. However, we never had to wait for service or for an elevator. We stayed in a suite on the 24th floor. We had the most spectacular view of the ocean from one deck and the beach and the mountains from another porch. We were treated to views of sea turtles taking their late afternoon swim on more than one occasion. Our suite was very comfortable and roomy. The furniture was modern and well kept. The house keeping staff did an admirable job getting to work when we were out of the room. Each evening they came again to turn down the beds and to leave flowers and chocolate. Talk about special! We felt like royalty. There was always some kind of activity going on in the lobby. While we were there, an amazing sand sculpture of Santa Claus was created. We saw native Hawaiians carving totem pole faces. Each and every staff member we encountered was polite, caring and very helpful. We would return for another stay at the Sheraton Waikiki in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Spectacular, breathtaking - Go Sheraton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the first two night of our honeymoon at the Sheraton Waikiki and enjoyed every minute of it. From the minute we check in, we were provided with superior service. The bellhops, front desk attendant, concierge; all were great. We had a city view, which wasn't exactly breathtaking, but it wasn't a bad view either. The hotel is located right on Waikiki Beach, walking distance to dining, shopping, and entertainment. You walk out the back door and the ocean is right there, a few feet away. Pearl Harbor was a bit far ($40 in a cab). We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Right on Waikiki Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 days at the Sheraton and 3 days at the Hilton on Waikiki Beach. Both were very nice but I preferred the Sheraton. We had an ocean view room directly above the pool area. You could set on the balcony and enjoy a cool drink and watch and listen to the nightly poolside entertainment. Of course you could also go down to the pool. It is located right on the beach and also in the middle of many restaurants and shops, very close to the International Market area which was the reason we would pick it over the Hilton. Both are very nice.
reviews.title: Great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the first 9 nights of our honeymoon at the Sheraton Waikiki and it did not disappoint! We booked a city view room and got a free upgrade upon check in to a partial ocean view room as a honeymoon bonus. The room is a decent sized hotel room, not modern, but had a hawaiian theme which you're in Hawaii to experience anyway. The balcony size was really huge, and a partial or full ocean view is highly highly recommended, you would thank yourself while you're there for booking the view. The city view is nothing special but the beach sunsets and sunrises are just beautiful.
reviews.title: Fantastic Luxury Hawaiian Hotel

likes.liked: — everything, the whole hawaiian luxury ambience was amazing
likes.disliked: — Can't really think of a thing - tipping is annoying!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is huge and it's facilities are great. It's pool is fantastic, right along the beach - the strange thing is people walk past all the time to get across to Waikiki beach and can have a look-see over at the pool and where everyones lounging around but after a day of that you're used to it. The pool water was freezing and it wasn't an overly huge pool but big enough. The poolside cafe was great for lunch/snacks and cocktails - must try the non alcoholic fruit cocktail! It was something else and very addictive!
reviews.title: Nice view, nice food, nice people - But NOT like it used to be . . . .

reviews.text: Although I was in town for business, I managed to find some time to enjoy Waikiki. The Sheraton Waikiki is in a perfect area to walk to the upscale shops like Gucci and Louis Vuitton, and of course, is right on the beach. It's partnership with other similar branded hotels in the area makes it easy to charge everything to your room. The staff is friendly and knows everything about the area. Many of the rooms are recently renovated with flat screen TVs and their famous Sweet Sleeper beds. I stayed in an oceanview room and it was oversize and offered a spectacular view from the balcony. I can't wait to return to to the Islands and will definitely be staying at the Sheraton Waikiki again. Oh, and don't miss the mai tai's at the Sand Bar!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location

reviews.text: Just returned from the most wonderful stay at Sheraton Waikiki. Service was second to none, always helpful and ready to please. As you can see an Ocean View room offers magnificent views that captures the essence of Waikiki. The refurbished rooms were a delight and definitely shows excellent potential for recovery, for all the yet to be refurbished rooms. It certainly met the Sheraton standard for me and I would certainly return in future! Thank you for having made my stay an unforgettable treasure!
reviews.title: Everything I hoped it would be

reviews.text: This Sheraton Waikiki was fine for a weekend trip but would not stay for long period of time. The renovated rooms are nice and clean. To experience real Hawaii don't go to Waikiki, go to any other island. But to stay for a weekend, it was just fine and served it purpose.
reviews.title: Sheraton Fine for Weekend Getaway
Excellent location, views, and food!
reviews.text: I just returned from a trip with my parents and husband and felt compelled to write since there are so many negative reviews on this hotel. This is our third stay at Sheraton Waikiki and wouldn't stay elsewhere. We requested the renovated rooms and were not disappointed. The rooms were spacious, elegant, and very clean. We had a mountain view and a partial ocean view room. The partial ocean isn't worth the extra money - I'd stick with the mountain view.

The hotel is fabulous. The location is right on the beach and has two pools so there is always a spot in the sun. The hotel is VERY large and is bustling 24/7. This is a great hotel for anyone looking for a place on the beach with access to shopping, dining and entertainment. The feeling is more urban sophisticate - if you are looking for calm and tranquil, this is not the hotel for you. However, if you enjoy lots of opportunities for fun, sun and dining, this is your place.
reviews.title: Nice refurbished rooms

reviews.text: Just returned from our familys multiple destination trip that started with 5 days in Waikiki.
reviews.title: great deal
"Strong dislike" of this property
reviews.text: This hotel was not good nor bad. What made it good for me and my husband (traveling with our four children) was the great deal I got as a SPG(starwood preferred guest) member.
I recommend you sign up if you plan on staying here due to the fact that the prices can get crazy during peak season!! Upon check-in we got upgraded to a LARGE one bedroom oceanfront sweet.
reviews.title: Always a wonderful experience

reviews.text: We got 35% off the room rate and all my kids ate free. To top that off at the end of the trip we got 35% off all my husbands and my meals(we had to charge them to the room and got this discount for two restuarants in all four Sheraton hotels). What a deal!!
reviews.title: Worth your money!

likes.liked: — Its proximity to everything we wanted to do.

reviews.text: Pools where a bit small but the beach on either side was good.
reviews.title: Waikiki-Hated it
Positive Surprise
reviews.text: At the time of making reservations, we requested a wheelchair-accessible room and were told that each floor had two types of accessible rooms, one with a king-sized bed and regular shower/tub, the other with two full beds and a roll-in shower. We requested the latter and were told that none of the roll-in shower rooms had an ocean view. So the "city view" from our 14th floor room was no surprise, but the sight of a mountain range (but not Diamond Head)in the distance did compensate for an otherwise ugly view of neighboring high-rises.

reviews.title: beautiful hotel
reviews.text: We stayed her March 5, 6, 2007. We were suprising upgraded to a suite on the 24th floor. It was very nice & clean, a large living room, dining table, bar w/ coffee maker, refrigerator. It had a wonderful ocean view lanai from the living room and another ocean view lanai from the bedroom. A large bath, large bedroom w/ king bed. There were robes & slippers on the bed (to keep). The room itself -could have used a touch of paint in places where scrathes on the baseboard etc. The staff was very friendly and called us by name. The entrance to the hotel is open air and very upscale. The restuarant (breakfast buffet) was expensive $23.00 per person, but wonderful view of the ocean, I believe there were two pool areas. The hotel is in walking distance to many shops and is also on the trolley route. They have storage for you luggage, if you need to check out before your flight time. We paid to keep our room later - which wasn't bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will preface this review with the fact I stayed at this hotel during the weekend of the Honolulu marathon/U2 concert, so Honolulu was very very crowded. This being said, the Sheraton was a mess. We arrived after 4 p.m., and had to wait in a Disneyland type line for 2 1/2 hours even to get to speak to someone at the front desk to check in!! They only had 4 people attempting to check in hundreds of people. Obviously, they knew all these people were checking in, why not have enough people to check them in??
reviews.title: Nice enough rooms, good location, horrible staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The very surly front desk person basically set the tone for this hotel. Basically, the majority of the staff we encountered ran the gambit from complete indifference to down right rudeness. Of course, there were a few that were very nice and helpful, but they are definitely the minority at this hotel. I have never had valets who completely ignore you as you drive up and don't even say hello, just take your keys and ignore you. This was the standard service at the valet. I was shocked, but got over it.
reviews.title: Like Staying In Paradise

reviews.text: Make sure to get a renovated room, they are nice, nothing spectacular, but nice. We are Starwood Platinum guests so I think we got placed on a better floor, and we had a nice view. The rooms are oddly designed, seems like they are missing furniture or something, hard to describe, but if you stay there you will see what I mean. The beds are nice and comfy.
reviews.title: Mediocre for the price...

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Clean and friendly. I know that some reviews indicated problems with room quality but my room and corridor was very nice, clean and well furnished. Perfect location, friendly staff. The only problem we have noticed was rather long waiting time for lifts. I can recommend this hotel to all travelers.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in as part of my honeymoon. The hotel is OK in a lovely location but just ok.
reviews.title: Mmmmm not that great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked if we could have the best room possible and was told that the one we had was the best. Was it hell - we had reserved a partial sea view yip you could see the sea if you hung over the balcony with someone holding your feet!!! Don't bother paying the extra if you only going for that.
reviews.title: Ask them for a better room

reviews.text: The housekeeping was awful seriously bad we had sand in our sheets for the whole week and the room was ok if you like the simplicity of one bed, a pokey desk and chair and two lights!!
reviews.title: They will lie to you while they reach for your wallet!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki for 4 nights during a conference being held at the property and really enjoyed it. We would have enjoyed it more if we hadn't been working!
reviews.title: We liked it and would stay at the Sheraton Waikiki again

reviews.text: Our room was a newly remodeled Ocean Front with a King bed on the 19th floor. We received a conference rate of $249, which I thought was a good deal in comparison to what they usually charge for the room. The view was fabulous looking at the beach with Diamond Head in the distance. It looked like every picture we'd ever seen of Waikiki could have been taken from our balcony.
reviews.title: Unpleasantly surprised

reviews.text: We found the room was clean when we arrived and the housekeeping staff did a nice job of keeping it that way. The bed was very comfortable and we had no problem sleeping. The newly remodeled rooms are very modern and streamlined. We were at first concerned when we saw no dresser or anything with drawers to put our clothes. Not to worry. There is a large closet. Half of the closet is for hanging clothes and the other half has a shelving unit. There is also and iron, ironing board, and a safe in the closet. I want to take a moment to comment on the safe. I know its a funny thing to be impressed with, but I was. I have often looked at the size of the safes they put in hotel rooms and wondered what they expected you were going to put in it. Most that I've seen wouldn't hold much more than a man's wallet. This safe, however was the perfect size. Not too large that it took up valuable closet space, but large enough to hold all of our valuables. It held our laptop, 2 cameras and all the stuff to go with them, a pair of binoculars, wallets, and a small jewelry box with room to spare. It also had a combination lock that you set yourself, so no key to carry around with you. The room also had a desk, a chair and ottoman, and a refrigerator. Oh, and a TV of course, but we didn't have time to watch it so I can't really comment on it.
reviews.title: tremendous place

reviews.text: The bathroom was a normal hotel bathroom and was adequate. I felt it was a little on the small side.

Area-Absolutely perfect. Felt like in the middle of everything.

reviews.text: Overall feel- Felt like a train station. The dozens of elevators always packed; the lobby always bustling; even some people sleeping/lounging in the reception area. Weird. At least I got to meet Gene Simmons and Shannon Tweed!
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel But Not For Families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms- actually thought they were nice if not typical. Not as bad as I've read in some reviews. Quite spacious actually. BUT no privacy when using comfort room. What's up with using shutters to separate the main room from the bath room? Also, the shower curtain had a very musty smell. To their credit, they changed it upon first request.
reviews.title: a fabulous, relaxing experience

reviews.text: Also, balcony was definitely not private. One afternoon, I was watching the flat screen tv (nice); I look out and there's this older gentleman looking into our room from his adjoining balcony. Strange, strange setup.
reviews.title: mixed review

reviews.text: I had booked my stay through Expedia as a gift for my mothers 70th birthday. Now keep in mind my mother is a very fit 70 year old and never slow'sdown, so we were very busy. Everything about this trip was fantastic! I can not say enough good things about the staff at the Sheraton for all of "the little things" everyone from the front desk to the maintence man was helpful and always available when we called. The hotel is undergoing major remodeling but remains a very beautiful and grand hotel. Our rooms were the remodeled rooms,very spacious and the king size beds were excellant for a good nights rest. Our ocean front view was breathtaking and listening to the nightly hula girls and music was so much fun, I really did not want to leave for home. The location of this hotel is right downtown and you can walk everywhere to restarants and shops;so we never rented a car for in town driving. I look forward to our next stay here. By the way the beach and pool are at your fingertips!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!!!!

reviews.text: I had stayed at this hotel prior to "renovations" and understood why it had a few kinks but my recent visit to the "newly renovated" hotel reveled more of the same with new paint. I had two rooms one for my elderly parents in which they didn't even have a chair to sit down on ! and my room as a platinum preferred guest upgrade room which was just a small step above my parents one with no chair. The rooms are poorly designed, the desk and stool is not designed for anything more than a quick sit, not to work at the desk. The "sweet sleeper" bed was not as it is in other properties and was very uncomfortable. I would have thought that this property was a flagship of the chain in Honolulu but not a chance. The visit was topped off by a mediocre breakfast buffet with a quality below the local Denny;s and not worth the price charged. If you are a Starwood regular, you will be disppointed!
reviews.title: Choose Carefully Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a deluxe ocean view and upon arrival found we had been upgraded to the Ke Alaula suite on the 11th floor. We were stunned at the size of the room. The upgrade came with mixed review though. We had booked the Sheraton Waikiki for the recently renovated rooms. We love the feel and design of the new SPG rooms. The suite, though an awesome upgrade, was not styled the same. The truth may be that it simply has not been renovated as of yet. The room was nice enough but the bathroom was actually kind of dingy. It looked and felt original to the building. There were two balconies in the suite but the one in the bedroom was basically useless. It was set back into the building and only allowed for a view of a small portion of the Royal Hawaiian next door.
reviews.title: Unexpected Upgrade

likes.disliked: — The ammount of activity going on all the time.

reviews.title: Great hotel, crowded location
reviews.text: This really is a large/busy hotel. Not the kind of place you think of coming to relax and unwind. There were a LOT of LARGE tour groups coming and going at all hours. We personally never had to wait more than 15 or 20 seconds for an elevator. Most of the time they were just there. There was always 2 or 3 elevators in the lobby ready and waiting to go up.
The hotels location on Waikiki is great. We walked everywhere from there. Tons of shopping and restaurants within a blocks walk.
reviews.title: Beautiful views, nice service!

reviews.text: I was here for a conference with my family and this was are first trip to Ohau. This hotel was excellent and exceeded are expectations. The staff was excellent and so were the rooms.
reviews.title: Good!!!

reviews.text: If you have only a night or two in Honolulu and want to sample Sheraton hospitality in Waikiki on a budget, I would recommend the Manor (annexe) at the back of the Sheraton Waikiki. Ask for rooms 3607/9, 3707/9 or 3807/9 in the Manor, as these all have sea glimpses. The decor is somewhat tired, but the bed was comfortable and clean, and all the fittings worked. The room was quiet overnight, and close enough to the rest of the hotel to enjoy all the amenities. I found the pools and poolside areas clean and inviting, and the multitude of eating places (for high and low budgets) attractive. You can spend what you save on accommodation on enjoying Hawaiian hospitality!
reviews.title: To the Manor Born

reviews.text: Big Thanks to Trip Advisor people that write about their trip. After reading reviews for 6 months I felt I owed Trip Advisor a review of my recent Hawaii trip. I just returned from being married in Oahu (April 17 - 22). The reviews and advice by other people writing reviews were very helpful. The best advice was from someone that wrote a review last summer about becoming a Star Wood member (SPG--) for all the Sheraton Hotels on Oahu (Sheraton Waikiki, The Royal Hawaiian, Sheraton Moana Surfrider and Sheraton Princess Kaiulani).
reviews.title: We liked it

reviews.text: I was upgraded from Preferred Star Wood membership to Gold then I transferred American Express points for a free room and upgrade. I also let them know I was getting married. This also was an upgrade.
reviews.title: Filthy

reviews.text: Hotel: Sheraton Waikiki GREAT place to stay. We had a Mountain View which means we were facing north looking over Honolulu with Pearl Harbor, ocean and airport view to the left. Parking was $10 per day in parking deck.
reviews.title: Don't Do It

reviews.text: We stayed here last week - and I was worried, as I had read some less-than-stellar reviews on this site and others. It was really very nice, not perfect, but really very nice.
reviews.title: Much better than expected!!!

likes.disliked: — very little choice in terms of meals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought it was a great location - right in the middle of Waikiki - within walking distance of everything between the HIlton Hawaiian Village and Diamond Head. There is some construction going on at the mall/shopping center that is in front of it, but its not too bad. There are 2 or 3 ABC stores close by and plenty of places to eat.
reviews.title: Very Impressed
wow what a view
reviews.text: One big problem - there is not really anywhere in the hotel to get a simple or inexpensive meal - except the the bar, which is really just a bar menu and not really appropriate for children. For breakfast, the main restaurant had a buffet at $21 per person. Other than a cart with coffee and pastry, that was it in terms of selection for breakfast. We ended up walking to Denny's almost every morning - something on site would have been nicer.

Back to the location - steps to one of the best beaches in Honolulu - there isn't really a true beach in front of the hotel, but the one in front of the Royal Hawaiian, which is right next door, is great. Clean sand, clear water and turtles almost every afternoon.
reviews.title: Good hotel in the heart of Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the renovated rooms - very nice - but a few folks in our group stayed in some of the rooms not yet renovated - and they weren't very nice. Another bad - the floor below ours was being renovated during our stay - so we had to put up with very loud construction noise during the day - during my son's nap time. Also, both my husband and I are SPG Gold - and it really didn't do anything for us in terms of upgrades.
reviews.title: Million Dollar View

likes.disliked: — No beach. If you went to Royal Hawaiian beach you couldn't reserve their chairs.

reviews.text: Stayed here the week of July 16 for a conference. I give this hotel a "B". The location is excellent and the room size, decor and finish are generally OK. The biggest negative to this hotel is that you get the sense that it is simply underequipped for its size. I can vouch for the comments about long waits for an elevator. Although there are about 10-12 elevators, you have to wait a LONG TIME for one, even at off peak hours. The check in desk is also significantly understaffed; they definitely need more people there during peak hours, such as when people are checking out in the morning. The lines are long. I was attending a large conference on the second floor and everyone was trying to get between the first and second floors, but the escalator was out of service for most of the time I was there, forcing everyone to wait 10 minutes for an elevator each time you needed to get down to the lobby.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and views; slightly below average hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious for a regular hotel room. The furniture is recently updated. The desk area, which is comprised of a slide out glass half desk and a padded stool on wheels, is not that comfortable if you actually trying to get work done (and I recognize that most staying in Waikiki are not). And there is no wifi available in any of the guest rooms, although it is available in certain areas on the ground floor. The quality of the in-room coffee is horrible (I don't generally expect a whole lot from the complimentary in-room drip coffee, but this was truly nasty stuff). For the discounted conference rate of $210 I paid for a partial ocean view, it was not a bad deal because of the location.
reviews.title: Old Rooms
Great location, and wonderful staff!
reviews.text: The on-site concierge is pretty useless. I had a spare afternoon and wanted to sign up for an afternoon Kayak tour. They said they didn't know of any. This is a major hotel in the heart of Waikiki and they don't know of any Kayak tours? I went to a hotel next door and in about 30 seconds the concierge there gave me 3 different options.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My overall experience was spoiled by the poor room I had. The bed was terrible, the carpet was unclean, the room smelled musty, and the bathrooms needed updating. The location was great, but the room made the trip unpleasant. I immediately changed hotels. Please do not allow them to put you in the Sheraton Manor. --Request a renovated room in the towers!!
